wikipedia_page.main: Richard W. Sloley (20 August 1891 – 17 October 1946), sometimes known as Dick Sloley, was an English amateur footballer who played as an inside right in the Football League for Aston Villa. He was capped by England at amateur level and represented Great Britain at the 1920 Summer Olympics. Sloley formed short-lived amateur club Argonauts in 1928.
